Sonic Frontiers

Sonic Frontiers is an upcoming open-world platformer game developed by Sonic Team and published by Sega. It is scheduled to be released on November 8, 2022, for PC, Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, and Xbox Series X/S.

# Gameplay

Sonic Frontiers is an open-world game that takes place in a vast, mysterious world filled with ancient ruins, temples, and other secrets to uncover. Players control Sonic, who must explore the world on foot, using his speed and agility to navigate the environment and overcome obstacles. The game features a dynamic weather system and a day-night cycle, which affects the behavior and difficulty of the game's enemies.

The gameplay revolves around exploration, platforming, and combat. Sonic can perform various actions, such as running, jumping, and dashing, as well as using his spin attack and other abilities to defeat enemies. The game also features a variety of collectibles, including Chaos Emeralds, which grant Sonic new abilities and enhance his powers.

One of the key features of Sonic Frontiers is its dynamic combat system. Players can use Sonic's speed and agility to outmaneuver enemies and take them down quickly. The game also features a variety of enemy types, each with its own strengths and weaknesses, which players must learn to exploit in order to progress through the game.

# Plot

The plot of Sonic Frontiers revolves around Sonic's quest to uncover the secrets of the mysterious world he finds himself in. The game takes place after the events of Sonic Colors: Ultimate, where Sonic is transported to a new world through a mysterious portal.

## Another Story

In addition to the main storyline, Sonic Frontiers features a separate storyline called "Another Story," which takes place after the events of the main game. This storyline is not directly connected to the main game, but rather serves as a bonus content for players who have completed the main game.

In Another Story, Sonic is tasked with helping a group of characters, including Tails and Knuckles, to uncover the secrets of a mysterious island. The storyline features its own unique gameplay mechanics and challenges, and serves as a way for players to continue exploring the world of Sonic Frontiers after completing the main game.

# Development

Sonic Frontiers was developed by Sonic Team, a Japanese video game development studio that has been responsible for many of the Sonic the Hedgehog games. The game was led by Takashi Iizuka, a veteran game designer and director who has worked on many of the Sonic games.

## Conception

The idea for Sonic Frontiers was conceived several years ago, when Sega and Sonic Team began exploring new ideas for the Sonic franchise. At the time, the team was looking for ways to create a more open-world experience for Sonic, and to give players more freedom to explore the world and play the game in their own way.

## Design

The design of Sonic Frontiers was a collaborative effort between the development team and Sega. The team worked closely together to create a game that would meet Sega's vision for the franchise, while also incorporating the feedback and suggestions of fans.

## Writing

The writing of Sonic Frontiers was led by a team of experienced writers who have worked on many of the Sonic games. The team worked closely together to create a story that would be engaging and fun for players, while also incorporating the themes and elements that are characteristic of the Sonic franchise.

## Music

The music for Sonic Frontiers was composed by Tomoya Ohtani, a Japanese musician and composer who has worked on many of the Sonic games. Ohtani's music for Sonic Frontiers features a mix of electronic and rock elements, and is designed to evoke the sense of speed and excitement that is characteristic of the Sonic franchise.

# Marketing and release

The game's marketing campaign has been focused on highlighting its unique features and gameplay mechanics, as well as its connection to the Sonic franchise. Sega has also released a series of promotional items and merchandise, including a collector's edition of the game and a series of Sonic-themed merchandise.

The pre-release of Sonic Frontiers has been met with a mix of excitement and skepticism from fans and critics. Some have praised the game's open-world gameplay and dynamic combat system, while others have expressed concerns about the game's story and characters.

In an interview with Game Informer, Takashi Iizuka expressed his excitement about the game's potential, saying "We're really pushing the boundaries of what Sonic can do, and I think fans are going to be really surprised by how much we've expanded the world and the gameplay mechanics."

In a review for IGN, Alex Stedman wrote "Sonic Frontiers is a game that will satisfy fans of the series, while also appealing to new players who are looking for a high-energy, action-packed experience."

Jugjugg Jeeyo is a 2022 Indian Hindi-language family comedy film directed by Rajesh Krishnan, produced by Dharma Productions and Viacom18 Studios. The film stars Varun Dhawan, Kiara Advani, Anil Kapoor, Neetu Kapoor, and Maniesh Paul in lead roles.

**Plot**

The film revolves around a Punjabi family from Australia, who return to their village in India to settle down and start a new life. The story is about the struggles and challenges they face while trying to adapt to their new life in India, while also dealing with their own personal relationships and issues. The film was written and directed by Rajesh Krishnan, who is a well-known screenwriter and director in the Indian film industry. The film was produced by Karan Johar and Apoorva Mehta under the banner of Dharma Productions, in association with Viacom18 Studios. article:
Reformed Fundamentalmism

Reformed fundamentalism is a theological movement within conservative evangelical Christianity that emphasizes the authority of the Bible and the importance of maintaining traditional Protestant and Reformed doctrine. This movement is distinct from other Christian denominations and theological traditions, and its adherents often emphasize the need for a return to the original teachings and practices of the early Christian church.

# History and Main Leaders

Reformed fundamentalism has its roots in the early 20th-century fundamentalist movement, which sought to preserve traditional Protestant and biblical theology in the face of modernist and liberal challenges. Key leaders of this movement included J. Gresham Machen, who advocated for a return to the authority of the Bible and the importance of orthodoxy in the Christian faith.

The modern Reformed fundamentalist movement can be traced to the 1950s and 1960s, when leaders such as Carl McIntire and R.J. Rushdoony began to articulate a distinctive theological vision that emphasized the importance of Reformed doctrine, biblical inerrancy, and the need for a return to the early Christian church. McIntire's Christian Anti-Communism Crusade and Rushdoony's Presbyterian Christian Education Fellowship were influential organizations that helped to shape the movement.

# Theological Distinctives

## Broader Conservative Evangelicalism

Reformed fundamentalism is a subset of conservative evangelicalism, which emphasizes the importance of personal conversion, biblical authority, and evangelism. However, Reformed fundamentalism has a distinct theology and practice that sets it apart from other conservative evangelical denominations.

### Pertaining to Salvation and the Gospel

Reformed fundamentalists emphasize the importance of justification by faith alone, the sovereignty of God in salvation, and the centrality of the atonement in the gospel. They also stress the importance of regeneration and the necessity of a personal, conscious decision to accept Christ as Lord and Savior.

### Other Fundamental Protestant and Biblical Theology

Reformed fundamentalists emphasize the importance of the authority of Scripture, the doctrine of the Trinity, and the importance of the Reformed confessions, such as the Westminster Confession of Faith. They also stress the importance of the sacraments, the Lord's Supper, and baptism.

## The Inspiration and Preservation of the Scriptures

### Verbal Plenary Inspiration

Reformed fundamentalists emphasize the doctrine of verbal plenary inspiration, which holds that the Bible is the inspired, inerrant, and authoritative Word of God. They believe that the Bible is the complete and final revelation of God to humanity.

### Preservation of the Texts of Scripture

Reformed fundamentalists also emphasize the importance of preserving the original texts of Scripture, as well as the importance of accurate translation and transmission of the Bible.

## Common Principles of Reformation Evangelical Interpretation and Private Reading

Reformed fundamentalists emphasize the importance of private reading and interpretation of the Bible, as well as the importance of using the Reformed confessions and catechisms as guides for understanding the Bible.

## The Classical Creeds and Reformational Confessions

Reformed fundamentalists emphasize the importance of the classical creeds, such as the Apostles' Creed and the Nicene Creed, as well as the Reformed confessions, such as the Westminster Confession of Faith.

# Congregational Practices

Reformed fundamentalists often emphasize the importance of congregational worship, including the use of hymns, psalms, and the reading of Scripture. They also stress the importance of discipline and order in the church, as well as the importance of the local church as the primary institution for evangelism and discipleship.

# Bible Translation and Usage

## The Authorised Version Tradition, the Byzantine Received Text, and Eastern (Greek) and Western (Greco-Latin) Ecclesiastical Translation Traditions

Reformed fundamentalists often emphasize the importance of the Authorised Version (KJV) of the Bible, which is based on the Byzantine Received Text. They also stress the importance of the Eastern and Western ecclesiastical translation traditions, which emphasize the importance of accepting the Bible as the inspired, authoritative Word of God.

## Modern Versions, Denominational Preferences and Translation Controversies

Reformed fundamentalists often emphasize the importance of using translations that are based on the original languages of the Bible, such as the Greek and Hebrew texts. They also stress the importance of avoiding translations that are based on modernist or liberal interpretations of the Bible.

# Evangelical and Missional Apologetics

## Bible Apologetics

Reformed fundamentalists often emphasize the importance of using the Bible as a tool for apologetics and evangelism. They emphasize the importance of using the Bible to defend the Christian faith and to present the gospel to non-Christians.

# Liberal-Modernist Challenge to Verbal Inspiration and Truthfulness of Scripture

Reformed fundamentalists often emphasize the importance of maintaining the doctrine of verbal plenary inspiration and the authority of Scripture in the face of liberal-modernist challenges.

# Modern Biblical Criticism

Reformed fundamentalists often emphasize the importance of using the historical-grammatical method of interpretation, which emphasizes the importance of understanding the original languages and cultural context of the Bible.

# Modern Western Society and Intellectual Unbelief

## Criticism of New-Neo Evangelicalism and the 'Present Downgrade'

Reformed fundamentalists often criticize new-Neo evangelicalism and the 'Present Downgrade', which emphasizes a more relaxed and modernized approach to the Christian faith.

## Materialist and Naturalist Unbelief, and Historic Adamism and Creationism

Reformed fundamentalists often emphasize the importance of maintaining a historical Adam and a literal creation account in the face of modernist and naturalist unbelief.

# See also

* Conservative Christianity
* Fundamentalism
* Protestantism
* Reformed theology

# Resources

* McIntire, C. (1955). The Christian Anti-Communism Crusade.
* Rushdoony, R.J. (1959). The Institutes of Biblical Law.
* Warfield, B.B. (1927). The Inspiration and Authority of the Bible.
* White, A.D. (1896). A History of the Warfare of Science with Theology in Christendom.

# 2023 European Games

The 2023 European Games was a multi-sport event held in Poland from June 21 to June 30, 2023. The games were a major international sporting event, featuring a wide range of disciplines and attracting top athletes from across Europe.

## Host selection

The 2023 European Games were awarded to Poland in 2019 after a bidding process involving several European cities. The Polish city of Kraków was selected as the host city, with several other locations in Poland chosen to host specific sports and events.

## Votes results

The voting process for the host city was held at the 2019 European Olympic Committees (EOC) General Assembly in Poznań, Poland. Kraków received 43 votes, with the second-place bid from Istanbul, Turkey, receiving 26 votes.

## Organisation

The 2023 European Games were organized by the Polish Olympic Committee, in collaboration with the EOC and the International Olympic Committee (IOC). The games were led by a local organizing committee, with a wide range of stakeholders and partners involved in the planning and delivery of the event.

### Funding

The budget for the 2023 European Games was estimated to be around €400 million, with a significant portion of the funds coming from public sources. The Polish government, the European Union, and other international organizations provided financial support for the event.

## Opening ceremony

The opening ceremony of the 2023 European Games took place in Kraków on June 21, 2023. The ceremony featured a wide range of performances and events, including music, dance, and cultural displays.

## Venues

## Participating National Olympic Committees

A total of 50 National Olympic Committees (NOCs) participated in the 2023 European Games, representing athletes from across Europe.

## Medal table

The medal table for the 2023 European Games was led by Russia, with a total of 63 gold and 143 overall medals. The United Kingdom and Germany followed closely behind, with 45 and 43 gold medals respectively.

## Marketing

The 2023 European Games had a significant marketing presence, with a wide range of branding, advertising, and promotional activities taking place across Poland and online.

### Emblem

The official emblem for the 2023 European Games featured a stylized image of a Polish eagle, with the words "European Games Kraków 2023" written in a circular pattern around the eagle.

### Motto

The official motto for the 2023 European Games was "United for the Future," reflecting the event's focus on unity, solidarity, and progress.

The official mascots for the 2023 European Games were a pair of Polish eagle mascots, named "Zbyszek" and "Zosia." The mascots were designed to represent the values of unity, friendship, and fair play.

George Griffith

George Griffith was a British science fiction writer and educator, best known for his influential works in the genre. Griffith's writing career spanned several decades, during which he produced a significant body of work that captivated readers with its blend of science, adventure, and social commentary.

Early life

George Griffith was born on April 2, 1857, in Rockhampton, Queensland, Australia. His family moved to England when he was a child, and he spent his early years in the countryside. Griffith's education began at a local school and later continued at the University of London, where he developed a strong interest in science and literature.

Teaching career

Griffith's early career was marked by a period of teaching. He worked as a tutor and later as a lecturer at various institutions, including the University of London. During this time, Griffith developed a reputation as a skilled educator and writer. His teaching career provided him with a stable income and allowed him to pursue his writing interests in his free time.

Writing career

Griffith's writing career can be divided into several distinct periods.

Early career

Griffith's early writing career was marked by a series of poetry collections and short stories. His first published work, a collection of poems titled "Songs of the Army of the Night," appeared in 1888. Griffith's poetry was characterized by its focus on social commentary and its use of vivid imagery.

Breakthrough

Griffith's breakthrough as a novelist came with the publication of "Olga Romanoff" in 1894. This science fiction novel tells the story of a young woman who becomes embroiled in a plot to overthrow the Russian government. "Olga Romanoff" was a commercial success and helped establish Griffith as a major figure in the science fiction genre.

Mid-1890s

The mid-1890s saw Griffith produce a series of novels and short stories that built on the success of "Olga Romanoff." Works such as "The Angel of the Revolution" and "A Honeymoon in Space" showcased Griffith's ability to craft engaging stories that combined science fiction with social commentary.

Decline

Griffith's writing output declined significantly in the early 20th century. Several factors contributed to this decline, including the rise of more popular science fiction writers and Griffith's own health problems. Despite this, Griffith continued to write and publish until his death in 1906.

Final years

Griffith's final years were marked by a period of relative quiet. He continued to write and publish, but at a slower pace than in the past. Griffith's health problems had taken a significant toll, and he was forced to rely on the support of friends and family.

Death

George Griffith died on April 11, 1906, at the age of 49. His death was met with an outpouring of tributes from fans and fellow writers. Griffith's legacy as a pioneering science fiction writer continues to be celebrated today.

Legacy

Griffith's legacy can be seen in several areas.

Place in science fiction history

Griffith is widely regarded as one of the pioneers of the science fiction genre. His works, such as "Olga Romanoff" and "The Angel of the Revolution," helped establish science fiction as a major force in literature. Griffith's influence can be seen in the work of later science fiction writers, including H.G. Wells and Jules Verne.

Literary proficiency

Griffith's writing is characterized by its literary proficiency. His use of language is vivid and engaging, and his stories are often layered with social commentary. Griffith's ability to craft compelling narratives has made him one of the most beloved science fiction writers of his generation.

In relation to H. G. Wells

Griffith and H.G. Wells were two of the most influential science fiction writers of the late 19th and early 20th centuries. While both writers were known for their science fiction works, their styles and themes differed significantly. Griffith's writing was often more focused on social commentary, while Wells' works were often more concerned with the implications of scientific discovery.

Personal views

Griffith's personal views on various subjects are reflected in his writing.

Religion

Griffith's views on religion were complex and nuanced. While he was raised in a Christian family, Griffith's writing often critiqued traditional religious institutions. His stories often featured characters who challenged conventional notions of morality and faith.

Politics

Griffith's views on politics were similarly complex. While he was a vocal critic of socialism, Griffith's writing often highlighted the need for social reform. His stories often featured characters who fought against oppressive systems and advocated for greater equality.

Social matters

Griffith's writing often touched on social issues such as women's rights and the role of technology in society. His stories often featured strong female characters who challenged traditional notions of femininity and advocated for greater equality.

Publications

Griffith's body of work includes a wide range of publications.

Poetry collections

Griffith published several collections of poetry throughout his career, including "Songs of the Army of the Night" and "The Angel's Lament."

Novels

Griffith's novels are some of his most celebrated works. Notable novels include "Olga Romanoff," "The Angel of the Revolution," and "A Honeymoon in Space."

Short stories

Griffith's short stories are characterized by their blend of science fiction and social commentary. Notable short stories include "The Unseen" and "The Last Rival."

Short story collections

Griffith published several collections of short stories throughout his career, including "The Angel's Lament" and "The Unseen."

Non-fiction books

Griffith's non-fiction works are often focused on scientific and philosophical topics. Notable non-fiction books include "The Great Problem" and "The Mystery of the Universe."

External links

article:
**Turkey**

Turkey, officially known as the Republic of Türkiye, is a transcontinental country located in Western Asia and Southeastern Europe. It is bordered by eight countries, including Greece and Bulgaria to the west, Georgia to the northeast, Armenia, Azerbaijan, and Iran to the east, Iraq and Syria to the southeast, and the Mediterranean Sea to the south. With a rich history dating back to ancient times, Turkey is a culturally and geographically unique country that straddles the Bosphorus Strait, which separates Europe and Asia.

**Etymology**

The name "Turkey" is derived from the Middle English term "Turke," which was used to refer to the Turkic peoples who migrated from Central Asia to Anatolia in the 11th century. The Modern Turkish language, spoken by the vast majority of the population, is a member of the Oghuz branch of the Turkic languages. The name "Türkiye" was officially adopted in 1923, after the establishment of the Republic of Turkey.

**History**

### Prehistory and ancient history

The earliest human habitation in Turkey dates back to the Paleolithic era, with archaeological evidence showing the presence of various cultures, including the Neolithic and the Chalcolithic. The Hittite civilization, which flourished in central Anatolia between 1600 and 1178 BCE, is considered one of the most important ancient civilizations in Turkey. The Hittites developed a sophisticated culture, with a written language, a system of governance, and a complex pantheon of gods.

### Early classical antiquity

Following the decline of the Hittites, various ancient civilizations, including the Lydians, Phrygians, and Carians, emerged in western Anatolia. The Lydians, who ruled from 1200 to 546 BCE, were known for their wealth and their invention of coinage. The Phrygians, who ruled from 1200 to 346 BCE, developed a distinctive culture, with a strong emphasis on fertility goddesses and a complex system of governance.

### Rome and Byzantine Empire

In the 3rd century BCE, Turkey came under the control of the Roman Empire, which ruled for several centuries. The Romans developed a sophisticated infrastructure, including roads, bridges, and aqueducts, and introduced Christianity to the region. The Byzantine Empire, which emerged in the 4th century CE, ruled over Turkey for over a thousand years, developing a distinctive culture, with a strong emphasis on Orthodox Christianity and a complex system of governance.

### Seljuks and Anatolian beyliks

In the 11th century, the Seljuk Turks, who had migrated from Central Asia, established a series of beyliks in Anatolia. The Seljuks developed a strong military state, with a complex system of governance and a rich cultural heritage. The Anatolian beyliks, which emerged in the 12th century, were a series of Turkish principalities that emerged in western Anatolia.

### Ottoman Empire

In the 13th century, the Ottoman Empire emerged in northwestern Anatolia, under the leadership of Osman Bey. The Ottomans developed a vast empire, which stretched from the Balkans to the Middle East, and became a major center of culture, trade, and learning. The Ottomans introduced various innovations, including the Turkish bath, the tulip, and the coffeehouse, and developed a distinctive art and architecture, including the iconic Süleymaniye Mosque.

### Republic of Türkiye

In 1923, the Ottoman Empire was dissolved, and the Republic of Turkey was established, with Mustafa Kemal Atatürk as its first president. Atatürk introduced various reforms, including the adoption of the Latin alphabet, the separation of church and state, and the promotion of women's rights. The Republic of Turkey has since developed into a modern, secular state, with a strong economy and a rich cultural heritage.

**Administrative divisions**

Turkey is divided into 81 provinces, which are further divided into districts and municipalities. The provinces are grouped into seven regions, including the Marmara, Aegean, Mediterranean, Central Anatolia, Eastern Anatolia, Black Sea, and Southeastern Anatolia regions.

**Government and politics**

### Parties and elections

Turkey has a multi-party system, with several major parties, including the Justice and Development Party (AKP), the Republican People's Party (CHP), and the Nationalist Movement Party (MHP). Elections are held regularly, with the president and the parliament being elected by popular vote.

### Law

The Turkish legal system is based on the principle of the rule of law, with a written constitution and a complex system of laws and regulations. The Turkish penal code, which was introduced in 2004, has been criticized for its treatment of human rights and its emphasis on punishment.

### Foreign relations

Turkey has a complex system of foreign relations, with a strong emphasis on its membership in NATO and the European Union. Turkey has also developed strong relations with countries in the Middle East and Central Asia, including Iran, Russia, and Azerbaijan.

### Military

The Turkish military is a major force in the country, with a strong emphasis on defense and security. The Turkish military has been involved in several conflicts, including the Cyprus dispute and the Syrian civil war.

### Human rights

Turkey has been criticized for its human rights record, particularly in the areas of freedom of speech, freedom of assembly, and treatment of minorities. The Turkish government has also been accused of suppressing dissent and opposition.

### LGBTQ rights

Turkey has a complex and sometimes contradictory record on LGBTQ rights. While the Turkish government has taken steps to improve the rights of LGBTQ individuals, the country remains one of the most conservative in Europe, with a strong emphasis on traditional values.

**Geography**

### Biodiversity

Turkey has a rich biodiversity, with a wide range of flora and fauna. The country is home to several endangered species, including the Anatolian leopard, the Asiatic black bear, and the Southern white rhinoceros.

### Climate

Turkey has a diverse climate, with several different regions, including the Mediterranean, the Aegean, the Marmara, and the Black Sea. The climate varies from mild and wet in the north to hot and dry in the south.

**Economy**

### Infrastructure

Turkey has a well-developed infrastructure, with a strong emphasis on transportation and communication. The country has a large and modern airport system, with several international airports, including Istanbul Atatürk Airport and Istanbul Sabiha Gökçen Airport.

### Science and technology

Turkey has a growing science and technology sector, with a strong emphasis on innovation and research. The country is home to several major research institutions, including the Turkish Academy of Sciences and the Middle East Technical University.

**Demographics**

### Ethnicity and language

Turkey is a culturally and ethnically diverse country, with a wide range of ethnic groups and languages. The majority of the population speaks Turkish, with several minority languages, including Kurdish, Arabic, and Zaza.

### Immigration

Turkey has a complex immigration system, with a strong emphasis on controlling the flow of migrants and refugees. The country has been criticized for its treatment of migrants and refugees, particularly in the areas of asylum and integration.

### Religion

Turkey is a secular state, with a strong emphasis on separation of church and state. The majority of the population is Muslim, with several minority religions, including Christianity, Judaism, and Bahaism.

### Education

Turkey has a well-developed education system, with a strong emphasis on primary and secondary education. The country is home to several major universities, including the Middle East Technical University and the Istanbul Technical University.

### Health

Turkey has a well-developed health system, with a strong emphasis on public health and preventative medicine. The country is home to several major hospitals, including the Istanbul University Hospital and the Marmara University Hospital.

**Culture**

### Literature, theatre, and visual arts

Turkey has a rich cultural heritage, with a wide range of literary, theatrical, and visual arts. The country is home to several major literary figures, including Orhan Pamuk and Elif Shafak, and has a thriving arts scene, with several major museums and galleries.

### Music and dance

Turkey has a vibrant music and dance scene, with a wide range of traditional and modern styles. The country is home to several major musical instruments, including the saz and the lyre, and has a rich tradition of folk dance, including the whirling dervishes.

### Architecture

Turkey has a rich architectural heritage, with a wide range of styles and influences. The country is home to several major architectural landmarks, including the Süleymaniye Mosque and the Hagia Sophia, and has a thriving modern architecture scene, with several major architects, including Zaha Hadid and Norman Foster.

Turkey has a rich culinary heritage, with a wide range of traditional and modern dishes. The country is home to several major culinary specialties, including kebabs, baklava, and Turkish delight, and has a thriving food scene, with several major restaurants and food markets.

Turkey has a strong sporting culture, with a wide range of sports and activities. The country is home to several major sports, including football, basketball, and volleyball, and has a thriving sports scene, with several major stadiums and arenas.

Turkey has a thriving media and cinema scene, with a wide range of television channels, radio stations, and film production companies. **Heraclitus**

Heraclitus (c. 535 – c. 475 BCE) was a Greek philosopher from Ephesus, known for his philosophical ideas on the nature of reality, knowledge, and the human condition. His teachings had a significant impact on Western philosophy, influencing many subsequent philosophers and schools of thought.

**Life**

Little is known about Heraclitus' life, and most of what we know comes from secondary sources, such as his contemporaries and later philosophers who wrote about him. Heraclitus was born in Ephesus, a city in ancient Ionia, around 535 BCE. His father was a wealthy merchant, and Heraclitus was a member of the aristocracy. He spent most of his life in Ephesus, where he developed his philosophical ideas.

Heraclitus was known for his reclusive nature and his dislike of public life. He was said to have been a weeping philosopher, who would often cry while contemplating the mysteries of life. This aspect of his personality has been interpreted in various ways, with some seeing it as a sign of his deep emotional sensitivity, while others have viewed it as a manifestation of his melancholic and introspective nature.

**On Nature**

Heraclitus' philosophical ideas were centered around the concept of nature (phusis), which he believed was characterized by constant change and flux. He saw the world as a dynamic, ever-changing system, in which everything is interconnected and interdependent.

### Structure

Heraclitus' philosophical ideas can be seen as structurally based on the concept of unity and diversity. He believed that everything is connected and that opposites are ultimately one. This idea is reflected in his famous statement, "The way up and the way down are one and the same."

### Style

Heraclitus' writing style was characterized by its obscurity and paradoxical nature. He often used enigmatic statements and metaphors to convey his ideas, which has led to much interpretation and debate among scholars.

#### The Obscure

Heraclitus' style has been described as obscure because of the use of metaphors, paradoxes, and ambiguity in his statements. He would often use phrases that seemed to contradict each other, such as "The way up and the way down are one and the same," which has been interpreted in various ways by scholars.

**Philosophy**

Heraclitus' philosophical ideas can be summarized as a complex and multifaceted system that encompasses various aspects of reality, knowledge, and human existence.

### Unity of opposites and flux

Heraclitus believed that everything in the world is in a state of constant change and flux. He saw the world as a dynamic, ever-changing system, in which everything is interconnected and interdependent. This idea is reflected in his famous statement, "Panta rhei," or "Everything flows."

#### Panta rhei

The concept of "Panta rhei" was central to Heraclitus' philosophical ideas. He saw the world as a dynamic, ever-changing system, in which everything is interconnected and interdependent. This idea has been interpreted in various ways, with some seeing it as a manifestation of the cyclical nature of time, while others have viewed it as a reflection of the impermanence of all things.

#### You cannot step into the same river twice

This famous statement has been interpreted in various ways by scholars. Some have seen it as a reflection of the impermanence of all things, while others have viewed it as a manifestation of the cyclical nature of time.

#### Strife is justice

Heraclitus believed that strife (or conflict) was a necessary and just aspect of the natural world. He saw it as a manifestation of the tension between opposing forces, which is necessary for the maintenance of balance and order in the world.

### Logos

Heraclitus believed that logos (reason or intellect) was the fundamental principle of the universe. He saw it as the underlying order that governs the natural world, and as the source of all knowledge and understanding.

### Fire

Fire was a central concept in Heraclitus' philosophical ideas. He saw it as a symbol of the fundamental energy and vitality of the natural world, and as a manifestation of the cyclical nature of time.

#### Fire as symbolic

### Cosmology

#### Sun

Heraclitus believed that the sun was a central aspect of the universe, and as a symbol of the fundamental energy and vitality of the natural world.

#### Moon

The moon was seen as a reflection of the sun, and as a manifestation of the cyclical nature of time.

### God

Heraclitus believed that God was a concept that was beyond human understanding, and as a manifestation of the fundamental order of the universe.

### The Soul

Heraclitus believed that the soul was a fundamental aspect of human existence, and as a manifestation of the fundamental order of the universe.

#### Egypt

Heraclitus was influenced by Egyptian philosophy, particularly the concept of the unity and diversity of all things.

article:
**2022 COVID-19 Protests in China**

The 2022 COVID-19 protests in China were a series of demonstrations that took place in various cities across the country in response to the government's strict COVID-19 lockdown policies and zero-COVID strategy. The protests were sparked by a combination of factors, including frustration with the lockdowns, economic hardship, and the perceived lack of transparency and accountability from the government.

**Background**

### COVID-19 Lockdowns in China

China's COVID-19 lockdown policies have been some of the strictest in the world, with widespread lockdowns, travel restrictions, and mass testing. The government's zero-COVID strategy aims to eradicate the virus entirely, but has resulted in significant economic and social costs. Many cities have been under lockdown for months, with residents facing food shortages, economic hardship, and isolation.

### Democracy Movements in China

China has a long history of democracy movements, dating back to the 1989 Tiananmen Square protests. Since then, there have been numerous protests and movements calling for greater freedoms and human rights. However, the government has consistently suppressed these movements, often using force and violence to maintain control.

### Sitong Bridge Protest

The Sitong Bridge protest in 2021 was a key event that sparked the 2022 protests. On May 26, 2021, a group of residents in the city of Wuhan staged a protest on Sitong Bridge, calling for greater freedoms and an end to the government's zero-COVID strategy. The protest was quickly dispersed, but it marked a turning point in the country's COVID-19 response.

**Early Protests**

On November 27, a group of residents in Guangzhou staged a protest in the city's central business district. The protest was focused on the city's strict lockdown policies, which had resulted in significant economic hardship for many residents.

On November 29, a group of residents in Chongqing staged a protest in the city's central square, calling for greater freedoms and an end to the government's zero-COVID strategy.

The government responded to the protests by increasing censorship and cracking down on dissent. Social media platforms were blocked, and internet access was restricted in many areas. The government also detained many protesters, including prominent activists and journalists.

The protests also saw the use of blank paper as a symbol of resistance. Many protesters held up blank sheets of paper, which were seen as a symbol of the government's censorship and the people's desire for freedom of expression.

The protests had a lasting impact on China, leading to a re-evaluation of the government's zero-COVID strategy. The government announced a series of reforms, including the introduction of a "dynamic zero-COVID" policy, which allows for more flexibility in its response to the pandemic.

The protests had a significant impact on civic engagement in China, with many residents becoming more active in politics and demanding greater freedoms. The protests also highlighted the importance of social media in mobilizing public opinion and promoting civic engagement.

article:
Hurricane Idalia

Hurricane Idalia was a powerful tropical cyclone that affected several countries in the Caribbean and the southeastern United States in August 2023. The storm formed in the Atlantic Ocean and strengthened into a hurricane before making landfall in Cuba. Idalia's impact was significant, causing widespread damage and disruption to communities in its path.

# Meteorological history
Hurricane Idalia formed on August 10, 2023, in the central tropical Atlantic Ocean, approximately 1,000 miles (1,600 km) east-southeast of the Lesser Antilles. The system was a tropical disturbance that had been monitored by the National Hurricane Center (NHC) for several days prior to its development. At 11:00 AM AST (15:00 UTC), the disturbance had organized into a tropical depression, with maximum sustained winds of 30 mph (45 km/h) and a minimum central pressure of 1006 mbar (29.71 inHg).

As the tropical depression moved west-northwestward, it encountered favorable conditions for intensification, including warm ocean waters and low wind shear. On August 12, the system strengthened into a tropical storm, with maximum sustained winds of 60 mph (95 km/h) and a minimum central pressure of 994 mbar (29.36 inHg). The storm was named Idalia by the NHC, becoming the seventh named storm of the 2023 Atlantic hurricane season.

Idalia continued to strengthen over the next 24 hours, with the storm's maximum sustained winds reaching 120 mph (195 km/h) and a minimum central pressure of 960 mbar (28.35 inHg). At this point, Idalia was classified as a Category 3 hurricane on the Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Wind Scale.

## Cuba
As Idalia approached Cuba, the government issued a hurricane warning for the island's eastern provinces, including Santiago de Cuba and Granma. Residents were advised to take necessary precautions, including boarding up windows and stocking up on food and water.

On August 14, Idalia made landfall in southeastern Cuba, near the town of Baracoa, with maximum sustained winds of 140 mph (225 km/h) and a minimum central pressure of 950 mbar (28.05 inHg). article:
Thor: Love and Thunder is a 2022 American superhero film based on the Marvel Comics character Thor, produced by Marvel Studios and distributed by Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures. The film is the sequel to Thor: Ragnarok (2017) and the 29th film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU).

**Plot**

The film takes place after the events of Avengers: Endgame. Thor (Chris Hemsworth) is living a peaceful life on Earth with the Guardians of the Galaxy, but he is struggling to find his purpose after the defeat of Thanos. Meanwhile, Jane Foster (Natalie Portman), Thor's former girlfriend, has become the new Thor, wielding the mighty hammer Mjolnir.

As Jane and Thor (the original) team up to stop the villainous Gorr the God Butcher (Christian Bale), they must confront their own personal demons and learn to work together to save the world from Gorr's god-slaying madness. Along the way, they are joined by Valkyrie (Tessa Thompson), Korg (Taika Waititi), and other familiar faces from the MCU.

**Cast**

* Chris Hemsworth as Thor
* Natalie Portman as Jane Foster / Thor
* Christian Bale as Gorr the God Butcher
* Tessa Thompson as Valkyrie
* Taika Waititi as Korg
* Russell Crowe as Zeus
* Jeff Goldblum as Grandmaster
* Sam Neill as Odin
* Brittany Ashworth as Darcy Lewis
* Dave Bautista as Drax the Destroyer
* Karen Gillan as Nebula

* Sean Gunn as Kree Lieutenant

**Production**

### Development

The development of Thor: Love and Thunder began in 2017, shortly after the release of Thor: Ragnarok. Taika Waititi, who directed and co-wrote Ragnarok, was set to return to the franchise to direct and co-write the new film. The project was initially titled Thor 4, but was later changed to Thor: Love and Thunder.

### Writing

The screenplay for Thor: Love and Thunder was written by Taika Waititi and Jennifer Kaytin Robinson. The film's story was influenced by the classic comic book series by Walt Simonson, which introduced the character of Surtur and the concept of the Nine Realms.

**Pre-production**

Pre-production for Thor: Love and Thunder began in late 2020, with Chris Hemsworth, Natalie Portman, and Christian Bale all set to return to their respective roles. The film's production design was overseen by Bo Welch, who also worked on the sets for Thor: Ragnarok and Avengers: Endgame.

**Filming**

**The Bloodline (professional wrestling)**

The Bloodline is a professional wrestling stable in WWE, consisting of a group of wrestlers who frequently team together and share a familial storyline. The group has undergone several iterations and changes over the years, but its core focus has remained on the familial relationships and dynamics between its members.

**Background**

The Bloodline's concept is heavily rooted in Polynesian culture and the idea of a close-knit family unit. The group's storylines often revolve around themes of loyalty, respect, and the bonds of family, drawing heavily from Samoan and Tongan traditions. This cultural emphasis has been a key aspect of the group's identity and has helped to set it apart from other professional wrestling stables.

**History**

### The Usos' feud with The Shield (2013–2014)

The Bloodline's roots can be traced back to the early days of The Usos, a tag team consisting of brothers Jimmy and Jey Uso. The Usos began feuding with The Shield, a dominant faction in WWE at the time, in 2013. The Usos' storyline with The Shield was marked by a significant increase in their popularity and exposure, as they began to establish themselves as a force to be reckoned with in the WWE.

### Occasional team-ups (2015–2020)

Following their feud with The Shield, The Usos continued to compete as a tag team, occasionally teaming up with other wrestlers in the WWE. During this period, they also began to establish a rivalry with other factions, including The Wyatt Family and The New Day.

### Roman Reigns' leadership (2020–2024)

In 2020, Roman Reigns, a WWE superstar of Samoan descent, began to play a significant role in the storyline of The Bloodline. Reigns, who had previously competed as a solo performer, began to build a family unit around himself, incorporating The Usos and other wrestlers into his storyline.

#### Official Formation of The Bloodline (2020–2021)

The Bloodline officially formed in 2020, with Roman Reigns at the helm. The group's early days were marked by a series of promotional events and storyline matches, as Reigns and The Usos began to establish themselves as a dominant force in the WWE.

#### All champions, rivalry with The New Day (2021–2022)

In 2021, The Bloodline achieved a significant milestone when all three members of the group (Reigns, The Usos, and Paul Heyman) held a championship title in the WWE. This led to a rivalry with The New Day, a faction that had also achieved similar success. The rivalry between The Bloodline and The New Day was marked by a series of intense matches and storyline developments.

#### Induction of Sami Zayn and Solo Sikoa (2022–2023)

In 2022, Sami Zayn and Solo Sikoa, a young wrestler of Samoan descent, were inducted into The Bloodline. Zayn's addition to the group marked a significant shift in the storyline, as he began to play a key role in the group's dynamics.

#### Bloodline Civil War (2023)

In 2023, The Bloodline was rocked by a civil war, as internal tensions and conflicts began to arise within the group. The storyline was marked by a series of intense matches and dramatic developments, as the group struggled to maintain its unity.

#### Addition of The Rock and feud with Cody Rhodes (2023–2024)

In 2023, Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson, a WWE superstar and cousin of Roman Reigns, made a surprise return to the WWE. Johnson's return was marked by a significant increase in popularity and attention, as he began to play a key role in The Bloodline's storyline. The group's feud with Cody Rhodes, a WWE superstar and member of the Rhodes family, was a significant aspect of the storyline, marked by a series of intense matches and dramatic developments.

## Solo Sikoa's leadership (2024–present)

In 2024, Solo Sikoa, a young wrestler of Samoan descent, took over as leader of The Bloodline. Sikoa's leadership marked a significant shift in the group's dynamics, as he began to establish a new direction for the group.

#### Additions of The Tongans and Jacob Fatu (2024)

In 2024, The Tongans, a group of wrestlers from Tonga, were added to The Bloodline. Jacob Fatu, a wrestler of Tongan descent, also joined the group, marking a significant increase in the group's Polynesian representation.

#### Bloodline Civil War II (2024–present)

In 2024, The Bloodline was once again rocked by a civil war, as internal tensions and conflicts began to arise within the group. The storyline is ongoing, marked by a series of intense matches and dramatic developments, as the group struggles to maintain its unity.

**Titan Submersible Implosion**

The Titan submersible implosion was a catastrophic underwater accident that occurred on June 18, 2023, while a submersible vessel, Titan, operated by OceanGate Expeditions, was on a dive to the wreck of the RMS Titanic. The incident resulted in the loss of all five lives on board, sparking widespread shock and outrage in the scientific community, the public, and the media.

**Background**

### OceanGate

OceanGate Expeditions is a private company based in the United States that specializes in underwater exploration and tourism. The company offers luxury expeditions to explore historic shipwrecks, including the Titanic. OceanGate's vessels are designed to accommodate paying customers, as well as scientists and researchers, on deep-sea dives.

### Titanic

The RMS Titanic was a British passenger liner that sank in the early morning of April 15, 1912, after colliding with an iceberg during her maiden voyage from Southampton to New York City. The Titanic sank in the North Atlantic Ocean, resulting in the loss of more than 1,500 lives. The wreck of the Titanic was discovered in 1985 by a French-American expedition led by Dr. Robert Ballard. Since then, several expeditions have visited the wreck site, but the site has also been the subject of controversy, with concerns raised about the impact of tourism on the wreck.

**Submersible Titan**

The Titan was a deep-sea submersible vessel designed and manufactured by Triton Submarines, a company based in Florida. The vessel was commissioned by OceanGate Expeditions for use on its luxury expeditions to the Titanic wreck site. The Titan was capable of diving to depths of up to 12,500 meters (41,000 feet) and was equipped with state-of-the-art life support systems, navigation, and communication equipment.

### Dives to wreck of Titanic

The Titan had made several successful dives to the Titanic wreck site prior to the incident, ferrying passengers and crew to the wreck for observation and exploration. The vessel had become a popular choice for tourists and researchers seeking to experience the Titanic wreck site firsthand.

### Safety

OceanGate Expeditions and Triton Submarines had implemented numerous safety protocols and procedures to ensure the safe operation of the Titan. The vessel was equipped with emergency beacons, emergency oxygen supplies, and communication equipment. The crew and passengers were also trained in emergency procedures and protocols.

### Prior concerns

In the months leading up to the incident, there were several concerns raised about the safety of the Titan and OceanGate Expeditions' operations. Some experts questioned the company's ability to manage the risks associated with deep-sea diving and the impact of tourism on the Titanic wreck site.

### Previous incidents

In the years prior to the incident, there were several reported incidents involving the Titan and OceanGate Expeditions. These incidents included equipment failures, communication malfunctions, and near-miss accidents.

**Incident**

### Expedition arrangements

On June 16, 2023, the Titan embarked on a luxury expedition to the Titanic wreck site, carrying five passengers, including a filmmaker, a historian, and three paying customers. The expedition was scheduled to last several days, with multiple dives planned to the wreck site.

### 16–17 June preparations

On the evening of June 16, the Titan's crew completed final preparations for the dive, including checking the vessel's systems, loading supplies, and conducting safety drills.

### 18 June, dive, disappearance, and implosion

On June 18, the Titan descended to the Titanic wreck site, but contact with the vessel was lost shortly after arrival. Despite extensive search efforts, the Titan was never recovered, and all on board were presumed dead. An investigation later revealed that the vessel had imploded, causing the loss of all lives on board.

### 18–22 June, search and rescue efforts

Following the loss of contact with the Titan, a massive search and rescue effort was launched by the United States Coast Guard, the Canadian Coast Guard, and other agencies. The search operation involved multiple vessels, aircraft, and submersibles, but no signs of the Titan or its crew were found.

### 22 June, discovery of debris

On June 22, debris from the Titan was discovered on the seafloor, including the vessel's wreckage and personal effects of the crew and passengers.

### Fatalities

The five passengers on board the Titan were all pronounced dead, with the cause of death attributed to the implosion of the vessel.

**Recovery operations**

The recovery of the Titan's wreckage and personal effects from the seafloor was a complex and challenging operation, involving multiple agencies and vessels. The recovery operation was carried out over several weeks, with the wreckage finally recovered on July 15, 2023.

**Investigations**

### United States

The United States National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) led the investigation into the incident, with support from the United States Coast Guard, the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI), and other agencies. The investigation was focused on determining the cause of the implosion and the failure of the Titan's safety systems.

### Canada

The Canadian Transportation Safety Board (TSB) also conducted an investigation into the incident, with a focus on the safety implications for the tourism industry and the Titanic wreck site.

**Lawsuit**

In the aftermath of the incident, a lawsuit was filed by the families of the passengers on board the Titan, seeking compensation for their loss.

**Financial costs of operations**

The financial costs of the incident were significant, with estimates suggesting that the recovery operation alone cost over $100 million. The incident also had a significant impact on the tourism industry, with many expeditions to the Titanic wreck site canceled or postponed.

**Reactions**

The incident sparked widespread shock and outrage in the scientific community, the public, and the media. The incident raised questions about the safety of deep-sea diving and the impact of tourism on historic sites.

**In social and mass media**

The incident was widely covered in social and mass media, with many outlets providing real-time updates and analysis. The incident also sparked a global conversation about the risks and benefits of deep-sea diving and the tourism industry.

The event featured a range of track and field events, including sprint, distance, hurdles, relays, and throwing events.

article:
**2022 Fukushima Earthquake**

The 2022 Fukushima earthquake occurred on August 19, 2022, in the Fukushima Prefecture of Japan. The earthquake was a significant seismic event that caused widespread damage and disruption to the region.

**Tectonic Setting**

The 2022 Fukushima earthquake occurred in a region of high seismic activity, where the Pacific plate is being subducted beneath the North American plate. This process, known as subduction, is responsible for the formation of the Japanese island arc and the creation of deep-sea trenches. The region is characterized by a complex system of faults, including the Fukushima-Nanokaichi fault, which runs along the coast of Fukushima Prefecture.

The Japanese island arc is a region of high volcanic and seismic activity, with numerous earthquakes and volcanic eruptions occurring throughout the country's history. The Fukushima earthquake was a significant event in this region, highlighting the ongoing tectonic processes that shape Japan's geology.

**Earthquake**

The 2022 Fukushima earthquake was a magnitude 6.2 earthquake that occurred at 22:03 local time on August 19, 2022. The epicenter of the earthquake was located in the Fukushima Prefecture, approximately 50 kilometers east of the city of Fukushima. The earthquake was a shallow event, with a depth of approximately 10 kilometers.

The earthquake was characterized by a series of strong tremors, with reports of buildings shaking violently and objects falling from shelves. The earthquake was also accompanied by a series of aftershocks, which continued to occur in the days and weeks following the initial event.

**Intensity**

The intensity of the earthquake was measured in various locations throughout the Fukushima Prefecture. In the city of Fukushima, the intensity was reported to be as high as 4 on the JMA seismic intensity scale, which is equivalent to a Modified Mercalli Intensity (MMI) of VI. In other locations, the intensity was reported to be as low as 1 on the JMA scale, with no damage or injuries reported.

The earthquake was also felt in other parts of Japan, including the Tokyo metropolitan area, where the intensity was reported to be as low as 1 on the JMA scale.

**Long Period Ground Motion**

The 2022 Fukushima earthquake was characterized by a long period ground motion, which is a type of seismic motion that occurs at frequencies of less than 0.05 Hz. This type of motion is often associated with earthquakes that occur in sedimentary basins, where the soil and sediment can amplify the seismic motion.

The long period ground motion in the 2022 Fukushima earthquake was reported to be as high as 10 seconds, which is significantly longer than the typical short period ground motion that occurs in earthquakes. This type of motion can cause significant damage to buildings and infrastructure, particularly those that are not designed to withstand such long period motions.

**Tsunami**

A tsunami warning was issued for the Fukushima Prefecture following the earthquake, as there were concerns that a tsunami could occur due to the earthquake's magnitude and location. However, the tsunami warning was later downgraded to a tsunami advisory, as the tsunami waves that did occur were not as large as predicted.

The tsunami waves that did occur were reported to be as high as 1 meter in some locations, with reports of coastal flooding and damage to coastal infrastructure. However, the tsunami waves were not as severe as predicted, and the damage was relatively limited.

**Impact**

The 2022 Fukushima earthquake had a significant impact on the region, with reports of widespread damage to buildings, infrastructure, and the environment. In the city of Fukushima, the earthquake caused significant damage to buildings, including schools, hospitals, and commercial buildings.

**Schools**

The earthquake caused significant damage to schools in the Fukushima Prefecture, including the Fukushima Prefectural High School, which was severely damaged and had to be evacuated. Other schools in the region also reported damage, including broken windows, damaged roofs, and cracked walls.

**Commercial Business and Industrial Sector**

The earthquake had a significant impact on the commercial business and industrial sector in the Fukushima Prefecture, with reports of damage to factories, warehouses, and other industrial facilities. The earthquake also caused disruptions to the supply chain, with reports of delayed shipments and cancelled orders.

**Power Outages**

The earthquake caused widespread power outages in the Fukushima Prefecture, with reports of over 100,000 households losing electricity. The power outages were caused by damage to power lines and substations, as well as a loss of generation capacity.

**Transportation**

The earthquake caused disruptions to transportation in the Fukushima Prefecture, with reports of delayed trains and buses. The earthquake also caused damage to roads and highways, with reports of landslides and debris blocking roads.

**Casualties**

Fortunately, there were no reported fatalities or serious injuries in the 2022 Fukushima earthquake. However, the earthquake did cause significant disruption and damage to the region, with reports of over $100 million in damages.

**Response**

The response to the 2022 Fukushima earthquake was led by the Japanese government, with support from local authorities and emergency responders. The Japanese Meteorological Agency (JMA) issued a tsunami warning for the Fukushima Prefecture, which was later downgraded to a tsunami advisory.

**Earthquake and Tsunami Advisory**

The JMA issued a tsunami advisory for the Fukushima Prefecture, which warned of the potential for a tsunami to occur due to the earthquake's magnitude and location. The advisory was issued to inform the public of the potential risk and to encourage evacuation of coastal areas.

**Domestic**

The Japanese government quickly responded to the earthquake, with Prime Minister Fumio Kishida declaring a state of emergency in the Fukushima Prefecture. The government also deployed emergency responders, including firefighters and rescue teams, to assist in the response efforts.

**International**

The international community also responded to the earthquake, with the United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction (UNDRR) and other international organizations offering support and assistance. **2021–22 NCAA Division I men's basketball season**

The 2021–22 NCAA Division I men's basketball season began on November 9, 2021, and concluded on April 4, 2022. The season was the 117th season of college basketball competition at the National Collegiate Athletic Association (NCAA) Division I level.

**Rule Changes**

Prior to the start of the season, the NCAA announced several rule changes aimed at improving player safety and enhancing the overall fan experience. One of the most notable changes was the introduction of a 30-second shot clock in the second half of games, a move intended to increase scoring and create more exciting finishes. Additionally, the NCAA implemented a requirement that players must wear approved knee pads and elbow pads during games, a measure designed to reduce the incidence of injuries. The NCAA also expanded its concussion protocol to include a mandatory 15-minute observation period for players who have been removed from the game due to a suspected concussion.

**Season Headlines**

The 2021–22 season was marked by several notable storylines and milestones.

### Milestones and Records

Several players achieved milestone and record-breaking performances throughout the season. For example, Duke's Paolo Banchero became the first freshman in NCAA history to record 60 points, 10 rebounds, and 10 assists in a single game. Additionally, Gonzaga's Drew Timme became the eighth player in NCAA history to score 2,000 points and grab 1,000 rebounds in a career. Other notable achievements included Louisville's Derek Williams becoming the all-time leader in three-pointers made at the university, and Michigan State's Gabe Brown becoming the all-time leader in blocks at the university.

**Conference Membership Changes**

The 2021–22 season saw several conference membership changes. The American Athletic Conference (AAC) announced that SMU would be leaving the conference effective July 1, 2022, to join the Big 12 Conference. Meanwhile, the Big Ten Conference announced that Maryland and Rutgers would be moving from the Big Ten to the Atlantic Coast Conference (ACC) effective July 1, 2024.

**Arenas**

### New Arenas

The 2021–22 season saw the opening of several new arenas, including the University of Oklahoma's Lloyd Noble Center in Norman, Oklahoma, which boasts a seating capacity of 11,000. The arena, which features a unique design that includes a translucent roof and a state-of-the-art sound system, is expected to be a major factor in the Sooners' success on the court.

### Arenas of New D-I Teams

Several new Division I teams opened their doors to college basketball fans during the 2021–22 season. The University of North Alabama, for example, began competition as a full-time Division I member in the ASUN Conference. The university opened its new arena, the Flowers Hall, in October 2021, which features a seating capacity of 3,000.

### Arenas Closing

Unfortunately, the 2021–22 season also saw the closure of several arenas. The University of Idaho, for example, closed its Kibbie Dome in Moscow, Idaho, due to structural concerns and limited funding. **2023 North Indian Ocean cyclone season**

The 2023 North Indian Ocean cyclone season was the period of the year when most tropical cyclones form in the North Indian Ocean. The season officially started on April 1, 2023, and ended on December 31, 2023. This period is also known as the "North Indian Ocean cyclone season", which includes the Bay of Bengal and the Arabian Sea.

**Season summary**

The 2023 North Indian Ocean cyclone season was a relatively active one, with a total of 11 depressions and cyclonic storms forming during the season. Of these, 7 were classified as severe cyclonic storms, and 3 were classified as extremely severe cyclonic storms. The season saw a total of 5 landfalls, with 2 making landfall in India, 2 in Bangladesh, and 1 in Oman.

**Systems**

#### Depression BOB 01

Depression BOB 01 was the first system of the season, which formed on April 15, 2023, in the Bay of Bengal. The system initially moved westward, but later turned northward due to an upper-level trough. It made landfall on April 18, 2023, in Odisha, India, as a depression. The system caused significant damage and flooding in the region, with estimated losses of over ₹100 crores (approximately $13.5 million USD).

#### Extremely Severe Cyclonic Storm Mocha

Extremely Severe Cyclonic Storm Mocha was the first cyclonic storm of the season, which formed on May 10, 2023, in the Arabian Sea. The system initially moved westward, but later turned northward due to an upper-level ridge. It made landfall on May 12, 2023, in Gujarat, India, as an extremely severe cyclonic storm. The system caused significant damage and flooding in the region, with estimated losses of over ₹200 crores (approximately $27 million USD).

#### Deep Depression BOB 03

Deep Depression BOB 03 was a tropical cyclone that formed on July 25, 2023, in the Bay of Bengal. The system initially moved westward, but later turned northward due to an upper-level ridge. It made landfall on July 27, 2023, in Odisha, India, as a deep depression. The system caused significant damage and flooding in the region, with estimated losses of over ₹50 crores (approximately $6.75 million USD).

Depression ARB 02 was a tropical cyclone that formed on August 10, 2023, in the Arabian Sea. The system initially moved westward, but later turned northward due to an upper-level trough. It made landfall on August 12, 2023, in Oman as a depression. The system caused significant damage and flooding in the region, with estimated losses of over ₹20 crores (approximately $2.7 million USD).

The system caused significant damage and flooding in the region, with estimated losses of over ₹600 crores (approximately $81 million USD).

#### Very Severe Cyclonic Storm Hamoon

Very Severe Cyclonic Storm Hamoon was a tropical cyclone that formed on October 5, 2023, in the Arabian Sea. The system caused significant damage and flooding in the region, with estimated losses of over ₹150 crores (approximately $20.25 million USD).

The system initially moved northward, but later turned eastward due to an upper-level trough. It made landfall on November 12, 2023, in Odisha, India, as a severe cyclonic storm. The system caused significant damage and flooding in the region, with estimated losses of over ₹30 crores (approximately $4.05 million USD).

#### Severe Cyclonic Storm Michaung

Severe Cyclonic Storm Michaung was a tropical cyclone that formed on December 1, 2023, in the Arabian Sea. The system initially moved westward, but later turned northward due to an upper-level ridge. It made landfall on December 3, 2023, in Oman as a severe cyclonic storm. article:
**Indiewood**

Indiewood is a term used to describe a subgenre of independent American cinema that emerged in the 1970s and gained popularity in the 1980s and 1990s. It is characterized by low-budget, often art-house films that often focus on social commentary, character studies, and experimental storytelling. Indiewood films often have a unique tone and style, blending elements of art-house, drama, and comedy.

Indiewood films often have a lower production budget than major Hollywood productions, which allows for greater creative freedom and experimentation. This has led to the development of a distinct aesthetic and style, often characterized by a more nuanced and character-driven approach to storytelling.

**Divisions**

Indiewood can be further divided into several subgenres and styles, including:

* **Pre-Indiewood**: Films produced before the 1970s that share similar characteristics with Indiewood films, such as low budgets and experimental storytelling.
* **Low-budget Indies**: Films produced on extremely low budgets, often with limited resources and a DIY approach.
* **Indiewood Blockbusters**: Films that achieve mainstream success and higher budgets, often blurring the lines between Indiewood and mainstream cinema.
* **Indie Drama**: Films that focus on character studies and social commentary, often with a more serious tone.
* **Indie Comedies**: Films that use humor to explore social issues and character relationships.

**Other "mini-major" subdivisions/indie distributors**

Several other companies and distributors have emerged to support the production and distribution of Indiewood films, including:

* **Miramax**: Founded in 1979, Miramax became one of the most prominent distributors of Indiewood films, releasing titles such as _Sex, Lies, and Videotape_ and _Pulp Fiction_.
* **New Line Cinema**: Founded in 1967, New Line Cinema has released a number of Indiewood titles, including _The Blair Witch Project_ and _Donnie Darko_.
* **Lionsgate**: Founded in 1997, Lionsgate has become a leading distributor of Indiewood films, releasing titles such as _Crash_ and _Borat: Cultural Learnings of America for Make Benefit Glorious Nation of Kazakhstan_.
* **IFC**: Founded in 1994, IFC (Independent Film Channel) has become a leading distributor of Indiewood films, releasing titles such as _The Station Agent_ and _The Trip_.

**Differences from Hollywood**

Indiewood films often differ from mainstream Hollywood productions in several key ways:

* **Budget**: Indiewood films are often produced on lower budgets, which allows for greater creative freedom and experimentation.
* **Tone**: Indiewood films often have a more nuanced and character-driven approach to storytelling, which can be more subtle and less bombastic than mainstream Hollywood films.
* **Style**: Indiewood films often blend elements of art-house, drama, and comedy, which can create a unique and distinctive aesthetic.
* **Distribution**: Indiewood films are often released in limited release, which can make them harder to find and access.

**List of selected Indiewood/Pre-Indiewood filmmakers**

* **John Cassavetes**: Known for his low-budget, character-driven films such as _Shadows_ and _A Woman Under the Influence_.
* **John Sayles**: Known for his socially conscious films such as _The Brother from Another Planet_ and _Eight Men Out_.
* **Jim Jarmusch**: Known for his experimental and offbeat films such as _Stranger Than Paradise_ and _Down by Law_.
* **Richard Linklater**: Known for his innovative and experimental films such as _Slacker_ and _Dazed and Confused_.
* **Spike Jonze**: Known for his innovative and quirky films such as _Being John Malkovich_ and _Her_.

**List of notable and important Indiewood films**

### 1980s

**Russian Information War Against Ukraine**

The Russian information war against Ukraine is a long-standing campaign of psychological warfare, disinformation, and propaganda conducted by the Russian government against Ukraine. This conflict is a manifestation of Russia's broader information operations, which have been ongoing since the collapse of the Soviet Union. The war has been characterized by a range of tactics, including censorship, control of news outlets, disinformation, and the use of social media to shape public opinion.

**Background**

The Russian information war against Ukraine is rooted in the country's doctrine of "information warfare." This doctrine views information as a key component of military power, and seeks to use it to achieve strategic goals. The Russian military has developed a range of tactics and techniques to achieve these goals, including the use of disinformation, propaganda, and cyber warfare.

One of the primary drivers of the Russian information war against Ukraine is revanchism – the desire to restore Russia's influence and power in the region. article:
Chris Hipkins

Chris Hipkins is a New Zealand politician who has served as a Member of Parliament (MP) since 2008. He has held various roles within the Labour Party and has been a prominent figure in New Zealand's politics.

#Early life

Chris Hipkins was born on June 5, 1978, in Lower Hutt, New Zealand. He grew up in the suburb of Lower Hutt and attended Hutt Valley High School. Hipkins developed an interest in politics at an early age and became involved in the Labour Party while still in high school.

After completing his secondary education, Hipkins went on to study at Victoria University of Wellington, where he earned a Bachelor of Arts degree in 2001. During his time at university, Hipkins was involved in various student politics and activism, which further solidified his interest in politics.

#In Opposition, 2008–2017

##Standing as a parliamentary candidate (2008)

In 2008, Hipkins decided to stand as a parliamentary candidate for the Labour Party in the Hutt South electorate. He was selected as the party's candidate and went on to win the seat in the 2008 general election. Hipkins's victory marked the beginning of his parliamentary career, and he was sworn in as a Member of Parliament on November 8, 2008.

##First term (2008–2011)

Hipkins's first term in parliament was marked by his involvement in various select committees and his role as a spokesperson for the Labour Party on issues related to education and transport. He quickly established himself as a vocal and active MP, often taking part in debates and questioning government ministers.

During his first term, Hipkins also became involved in the Labour Party's efforts to address the issues of climate change and sustainable energy. He argued that New Zealand needed to take a more proactive approach to reducing its carbon footprint and transitioning to renewable energy sources.

##Second term (2011–2014)

In the 2011 general election, Hipkins was re-elected as the MP for Hutt South, increasing his majority. During his second term, Hipkins continued to play a key role in the Labour Party's efforts to address the issues of education and transport. He also became involved in the party's efforts to address the issue of poverty and inequality.

Hipkins was also appointed as the Labour Party's spokesperson on social development, and he worked to highlight the issues of poverty and inequality in New Zealand. He argued that the government needed to take a more comprehensive approach to addressing these issues, including increasing funding for social services and implementing policies to reduce poverty.

##Third term (2014–2017)

In the 2014 general election, Hipkins was re-elected as the MP for Hutt South, increasing his majority once again. During his third term, Hipkins continued to play a key role in the Labour Party's efforts to address the issues of education and transport. He also became involved in the party's efforts to address the issue of housing affordability.

Hipkins argued that the government needed to take a more proactive approach to addressing the issue of housing affordability, including increasing funding for social housing and implementing policies to reduce the cost of living. He also argued that the government needed to take a more comprehensive approach to addressing the issues of poverty and inequality, including increasing funding for social services and implementing policies to reduce poverty.

#In Government (2017–2023)

##Fourth term (2017–2020)

In the 2017 general election, Hipkins was re-elected as the MP for Hutt South, increasing his majority. After the election, Hipkins was appointed as the Deputy Leader of the Labour Party and the Minister for Education. As Minister for Education, Hipkins worked to implement the Labour Party's education policy, including increasing funding for schools and implementing policies to improve student outcomes.

During his time as Minister for Education, Hipkins also worked to address the issue of student well-being, including increasing funding for counseling services and implementing policies to reduce bullying and harassment in schools.

##Fifth term (2020–2023)

In the 2020 general election, Hipkins was re-elected as the MP for Hutt South, increasing his majority once again. After the election, Hipkins was appointed as the Deputy Prime Minister and Minister for Health. As Minister for Health, Hipkins worked to address the issue of COVID-19 in New Zealand, including implementing public health measures to reduce the spread of the virus and increasing funding for the healthcare sector.

During his time as Minister for Health, Hipkins also worked to address the issue of healthcare workforce shortages, including increasing funding for healthcare training programs and implementing policies to attract and retain healthcare workers.

#Prime Minister (2023)

##Nomination and appointment

On January 25, 2023, the Labour Party announced that Hipkins would be the party's nominee for Prime Minister after Jacinda Ardern's resignation. After being nominated, Hipkins was appointed as the Prime Minister of New Zealand by Governor-General Dame Cindy Kiro.

##Domestic affairs

As Prime Minister, Hipkins has focused on addressing the issue of cost of living, including implementing policies to reduce the cost of living and increasing funding for social services. He has also worked to address the issue of housing affordability, including increasing funding for social housing and implementing policies to reduce the cost of living.

##Foreign affairs

As Prime Minister, Hipkins has also focused on addressing the issue of foreign policy, including strengthening New Zealand's relationships with its Pacific neighbors and addressing the issue of climate change.

##2023 general election

In the 2023 general election, Hipkins led the Labour Party to a narrow victory, winning 49 seats in the House of Representatives. The National Party, led by Christopher Luxon, won 37 seats, and the ACT Party, led by David Seymour, won 10 seats.

He has argued that New Zealand needs to take a more proactive approach to addressing the issues of poverty and inequality, including increasing funding for social services and implementing policies to reduce poverty.

The men's football tournament was scheduled to take place from September 24 to October 3, 2022. The matches were played in a group stage, followed by a knockout stage.
